page.title: 07The Hunt
page.content: When I went swimming on Saturday morning I saw a man come out of the wood. In his hand he was holding a fox. Then he blew his horn and a load of ladies and men came to the man. I was thinking, the poor fox. <<<<<<<<<**************>>>>>>>>>>> The local hunt is the{Aldenham {Harriers,}which began 110 years ago in Aldenham .They do not walk on foot but ride on horseback. There are between 30-50 members, and at least 40 harrier hounds which are kept at Lady Lyall's. Old and young dogs train together. They hunt twice a week from the middle of October to the middle of March. They hunt as far as St.Albans and Hitchin, and Ashridge and Barton LeClay.There are two Masters of the hunt. They hunt hares and sometimes a fox. Oddly, hares are increasing in numbers.
